subject: Leadership
title: Servant Leadership Ethics
description: A quick, practical guide to Servant Leadership Ethics.

hook.text: Most leaders ask: how can my team serve me? Servant leaders flip the question: how can I serve my team?

buildup.text: Greenleaf's servant leadership: the leader's primary role is enabling others' growth, well-being, and autonomy.

discovery.text: Ethical servant leaders listen first, empathize deeply, heal relationships, and build community beyond the bottom line.

twist.text: Critics call servant leadership naive. But companies practicing it consistently outperform peers on long-term metrics.

climax.text: Start each day asking: what does my team need from me today? Shift from authority to service. Results will follow.

punchline.text: The best leaders don't have followers. They create more leaders.

quiz.question: What is the core principle of servant leadership?
options: The leader's primary role is enabling others' growth and well-being
Serving only the most senior team members
